This document specifies the Chinese graphic characters used in information technology and their hexadecimal codes.
This document applies to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input, and output of Chinese and other character-based text information.

This document is applicable to technical products that process and exchange information containing Chinese and other text-based characters, including but not limited to software products such as input methods, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, voice synthesis, handwriting recognition, text-to-speech, and e-book readers, as well as portable devices such as computers, communication terminals, e-book readers, and learning machines.

The two-character binary block represents a character with two eight-bit binary positions: the first position is from 0x81 to 0xFE, and the second position is from 0x40 to 0x7E.

C and C++ compilers are integrated. They both require one or more steps to process input files: preprocessing (preprocessing), compilation (compilation), assembly (assembly), and linking (linking).
Source file extensions (.f, .f90, .f95, ...) identify the language of the source file, but for the compiler, the extension controls the default setting:
GCC considers the preprocessed files (.i) to be C source code, and sets the C linkage format.
g++ considers preprocessed files (.i) to be C++ code and sets up C++ linkage.
The postfix of the source file indicates the language type and the later operation:
.C C++ 源程序; 預處理, 編譯, 彙編
.cc C++ 源程序; 預處理, 編譯, compilation
. CXX C++ 源程序; 預處理, 編譯,彙編
.i C files after preprocessing; compilation, compilation
.s is the source code for assembly language.
.h preprocessor files; they are not usually included in the command line for other intermediate files that are sent to the linker (Linker). Usually they include:
.0 is the target file (Object file).
.a Archive file
Unless the -cec,-s, or -E options were used (or the compilation process was stopped by an error), linking is always the last step.

During the linking stage, all files corresponding to the source program with the .e extension, -1 library files, and files that cannot be recognized (including specified .o H header files and .a library files) are passed to the linker in the order specified on the command line.
Options must be specified separately: -d is not the same as -r.
Most of the `=-E : and `-W' options have two different formats: -fname and -fno-name (or -Wname and -Wno- name).

You can specify the "-Efno-dollars-in-identifiers" option to indicate that it is forbidden to use the `$' character.
(GNU C++ allows the `$' symbol in some target environments by default, but not all.)

Normally, GNU C++ allows a conversion from enum to int, but not the other way around.
-fexternal-templates produces smaller code for template declarations (only for C++) by creating copies of each template function only at the point of definition.
In order to successfully use this option, you must mark all files that use templates with the `#pragma implementatio'(definition) or `#Pragma interface'(declaration) keywords.
When the compiler is given the option '-fexternal-templates', all template instantiations are external types. You must make the needed instances appear in the implementation files.
This can be achieved by using the typeparam element, which references each required instance.
Conversely, if the default option "--fno-external-templates" is used during compilation, all template instantiations are explicitly marked as internal.
All member functions (except constructors, mnew, or delete member operators) are considered virtual for the class.
This does not mean that every time a member function is called, it will be called through an internal virtual function.
In some cases, the compiler can determine which virtual function can be called directly; in that case, it calls it directly.

After the custom free storage management mechanism for the user was translated to C++, the variable `this` became inappropriate.
Thus, assigning to this inside a member function by default is invalid.
However, for backwards compatibility, you can make this operation effective by using the '-fthis-is-variable' option.
-funsigned-char defines char as an unsigned type, like unsigned char.
Each machine has its own default char type. It may be unsigned char or signed char.
Ideally, when a program depends on the sign of the data, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char.
However, many programs have been written using only simple characters, and this is true for both symbolic and non-symbolic characters, depending on the target machine.
This option, and its counterpart, work so that the program operates on the corresponding default value.
The type of char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char, even if it represents one of them exactly.
If no explicit modifiers such as "signed" or "unsigned" are specified, these options are used to define a signed or unsigned field.
By default, the field is signed because they inherit the basic integer types, which are signed, but if the "-traditional" option is specified, the field is always unsigned.
-fwritable-strings stores string constants in writable data segments without special treatment.
This is to be compatible with some old programs, who consider changing string constants to be a very bad idea, and the '-traditional' option has the same effect.
Executive Summary
Its effects may be similar to the economic crisis in 2008.
The global Coronavirus pandemic has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.

In many countries, this disease has already led to overburdening of healthcare facilities, close to collapse, and severe disruptions caused by the measures implemented by governments in various countries have been observed in the global economy.
The impact on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be far-reaching.
Some producers may be forced to find new ways to produce drugs, as restrictions on movement are accompanied by restrictions on the acquisition of precursors and basic chemicals.
Traffickers are unable to cross borders due to travel restrictions, and are therefore forced to find new routes and methods.
The pattern of drug use and provision may change, and the government's response capabilities may also be impeded.
The changes brought by the coronavirus are unprecedented, but some lessons can still be learned from past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some drug users began to look for cheaper synthetic substances and adopted a method of injecting drugs.
At the same time, governments around the world have been cutting their budgets for drug-related activities.

If governments around the world respond to the current economic downturn in the same way, interventions to prevent drug abuse and related risky behaviors, as well as drug treatment services, may be severely affected.
In addition, priority for interception operations and international cooperation may decrease, making traffickers more active.
Some countries have a large amount of narcotics smuggled in through commercial flights, and it is expected that the direct impact on these countries' narcotics trafficking is the greatest.

Travelers often carry large quantities of synthetic drugs like methamphetamine in carry-on luggage or in private luggage. Because commercial air travel is restricted almost everywhere, the supply of drugs through air travel may be completely disrupted.
Although the international mail supply chain is also affected, the use of the dark web and parcel shipping for trafficking may increase.
In the long term, economic decline and related restrictions may disrupt the drug market.

With the rising unemployment rate and the lack of opportunities, the poor and vulnerable population is more likely to engage in dangerous drug use, contract drug-related diseases, and turn to illegal activities related to drugs, whether they are production or transportation.
Illicit organizations may take advantage of this situation to provide services to vulnerable populations and recruit new members to expand their ranks.
As the government's response capabilities declined, these changes could take root quickly, becoming a new reality for many communities.
Expansion and complexity
Market growth
The population growth model partially explains the reason for market expansion.
Drug use is increasing worldwide, whether in absolute numbers or as a proportion of the world population.

In 2009, it was estimated that there were 210 million people with drug addiction worldwide (4.8% of the population aged 15-64), while in 2018, this number was estimated to be 269 million people (5.3% of this age group).
In the past twenty years, the increase in drug use in developing countries has been much faster than in developed countries.

This to some extent reflects the difference in overall population growth between developed countries at 7% and developing countries at 28%, but also reflects the fact that the population of young people in developing countries is growing faster.
Teenagers and young adults are involved in the highest percentage of drug users.
During the period 2000-2018, the population in the age group in developing countries increased by 16%, while the population in the same age group in developed countries decreased by 10%.
1. Urbanization is a current and future driver of the drug market.
Whether it is developed or developing countries, the drug use situation in urban areas is higher than in rural areas.

One of the reasons for the overall increase in drug use is the large-scale migration of the population from rural areas to urban areas. Currently, more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, compared to 34% in 1960.
Urbanization may be a key factor in the dynamics of the drug market in the future, especially in countries with more pronounced urbanization trends.

The increase in wealth is associated with a rise in drug use, but the people who bear the greatest burden of disease are the poorest in the world, while developed countries have a higher rate of drug use than developing countries.
In the same way, within each country, the prevalence of drug abuse among the socially affluent is higher.
However, the rate of drug-related illnesses among those with low socio-economic status is higher than that of those with higher socio-economic status.
Data from a few countries show a clear connection between harmful drug use patterns and the prevalence of diseases among the poor.
These patterns seem to be less common in more affluent social strata.
The economic constraints caused by the COVID-19 crisis may worsen the risks faced by vulnerable groups, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labour market, such as rising unemployment, have traditionally been associated with increased drug use, and the COVID-19 pandemic has already led to the unemployment of hundreds of millions of people worldwide.

The COVID-19 pandemic may further expand the drug market, possibly due to increased farming by more farmers or the illegal cultivation of crops, or because of the weakening of government control, or because more people may be forced to engage in illegal activities in an economic crisis.

The related restrictions on COVID-19 have led to a reduction in air and land transport, while sea transport may have increased as a result, the seas are relatively safe and the number of smuggled goods is higher by sea than by air or land.
Recently, there have been reports that cocaine shipments are being directly transported from South America by sea to Europe.
Non-controlled substances are appearing in stable numbers, but new types of potentially harmful opioids are on the rise in the drug market.
Except for cannabis, cocaine and heroin, a number of synthetic drugs have been added, many of which are not under international control. The use of non-medical drugs is also rapidly increasing.
Approximately 500 new psychoactive substances are introduced into the domestic markets of member countries each year.
At present, most of them are stimulants, followed by a small number of cannabinoid receptor agonists and a few synthetic opioids.
Although the total number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized, the proportion has changed.
The total number of new psychoactive substances in the 2014 classification of new psychoactive substances is 2%, but by 2018, this number had risen to 9%.
Many synthetic opioids similar to fentanyl have been proven to have both drug effect and harmfulness, and they have caused overdose deaths in North America and other regions, but in lesser degrees.
In North America, fentanyl is sometimes used as a cutting agent for heroin and other drugs (including cocaine and methamphetamine), and sometimes to produce counterfeit opioids.

Evidence suggests that there is also the illicit manufacture and trafficking of stimulant-type new psychoactive substances in Europe: a study of residues in discarded syringes in six European cities found that many syringes contained substances that produce stimulating effects, which is a new phenomenon in Europe.
2. The use of new psychoactive substances may gradually become established in vulnerable groups.
Single types of new psychoactive substances rarely form large markets.
However, evidence from Europe indicates that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem in the groups of homeless people and prisoners who are on the margins of society.
Twenty-two countries reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons, with most of them identifying synthetic cannabinoids as the main challenge.

Control of precursor chemicals has forced drug manufacturers to innovate, and many chemicals used as precursors to methamphetamine, methylenedioxymethamphetamine (commonly known as "ecstasy"), and "ecstasy" have been placed under international control.

Traffickers and drug manufacturers have always been on the lookout for alternatives, not only those that are loosely regulated, but also those that are specifically designed to evade control, i.e., so-called "precursor chemicals designed to circumvent regulation."
Restrictive measures aimed at preventing the further spread of the coronavirus are likely to put additional pressure on drug traffickers who rely on precursor chemicals.
This is now a reality: According to reports, in March 2020, the shortage of methamphetamine precursors from East Asia led to a price increase for methamphetamine in Mexico and the United States.
In a fast-moving market.
Synthetic drugs have replaced opiates in Central Asia and the Russian Federation.
The opiate market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation seems to have changed between 2008 and 2018.
The number of opioids intercepted by Russian authorities has decreased by about 80%, while the number of people receiving treatment for opioid use has decreased significantly.
However, the market for stimulants seemed to be growing rapidly.
Evidence suggests that methamphetamine and various cathinones, including mephedrone and pyrrolidine, are now widely available on the Russian drug market.
The Russian authorities reported a sharp increase in the number of secret laboratories manufacturing various illicit drugs recently discovered, which doubled in two years and reached 152 in 2018.
The methamphetamine markets in Afghanistan and Iraq have grown significantly in recent years.
Already in 2012, investigations into hospital, prison and other institution staff had revealed the importance of methamphetamine in Iraq.
Crystal methamphetamine has become another major cause for concern, following fentanyl and tramadol.
A study conducted in 2015 further confirmed these findings, with drug users reporting that marijuana is harder to obtain than Captagon or methcathinone.

Recently, Iraqi authorities have discovered several methamphetamine manufacturing sites, and the Narcotics Control Board has expressed concern about the import of large amounts of pseudoephedrine precursors. Methamphetamine precursors are used at these sites to produce methamphetamine.
In Afghanistan, methamphetamine production appears to have started in 2014.
Since then, the seizure volume of methamphetamine has steadily increased.
However, the seizure volume in the first half of 2019 was 657 kg, a large increase compared to the previous year.
Large quantities of crystallized methamphetamine believed to be from Afghanistan have been seized in other countries, which indicates that production in that country is rapidly increasing.
Policy changes and trends of change.
The trend towards the legalization of marijuana for non-medical use is prevalent in most jurisdictions where marijuana use is increasing.
In Canada, Uruguay, and the United States, 11 regions allow the production of marijuana products for non-medical use.
In most jurisdictions, marijuana use has increased since legalization, although the same trend has been observed in jurisdictions that have not legalized non-medical marijuana use.

In the two states where marijuana was legalized first in the United States, Colorado and Washington, the number of adults using marijuana for non-medical purposes has increased, particularly in the past month and on a daily or almost daily basis, and has already exceeded the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that since 2011, Uruguay's marijuana use has increased, with the number of users in the previous month increasing almost tenfold.
This indicates that the main reason for the increase is frequent and frequent use of marijuana.
Canada's short-term data also shows that, while the legal market expanded from 2018 to 2019, use also increased.
However, in 2019, 40% of cannabis users still obtained some products from illegal sources.
The reason for the global drop in cannabis herb seizures is the legalization of cannabis?
In 2018, global seizures of cannabis herb fell to their lowest level in 20 years, due to a reduction in seizures in North America, which had fallen by 84% over the past 10 years.

Compared to this, the seizures in other parts of the world have almost doubled. The seizure patterns indicate that the policy aimed at legalizing the cannabis market has played a key role in the decrease.
The regulation of new psychoactive substances seems to be having an effect in the domestic market, but the effectiveness of regulation is still difficult to assess.
Countries that have adopted different regulatory approaches for new psychoactive substances show different levels of new psychoactive substance use.
In other countries, the use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after the introduction of national legislation.

Weakened groups face the risks of both legal and illegal drug markets for pain management and palliative care, and opioid painkillers are primarily provided in high-income countries for pain management. Pain relief is unevenly distributed across regions.
In 2018, more than 90% of the medical opioids available for consumption were produced in high-income countries.
Approximately 50% in North America, 40% in Europe, and 2% in Oceania.
Their population accounts for about 12% of the global population.
According to estimates, the population of low- and middle-income countries accounts for 88% of the global population, but only 10% of the population consumes prescription opioids.
Obtaining prescription opioids is associated with a number of factors, including legislation, culture, the health system, and prescribing practices.
People living in poverty are more likely to suffer from drug addiction. In 2018, about 35.6 million people were addicted to drugs.

Poverty, limited education, and social marginalization may increase the risk of addiction and exacerbate its consequences. This has been confirmed by studies in high-income countries, where individual socioeconomic trajectories are not only a reflection of their circumstances at a particular point in time, but also a factor in the risk of addiction.

Drug-related diseases also deepen social and economic disadvantages, further increasing the risks of unemployment, poverty, and homelessness, thereby perpetuating a vicious cycle of disadvantage. These results may also be related to the degrading attitudes and consequences found within the criminal justice system.
Women, ethnic minorities, sexual minorities, displaced people, and those living in rural areas may also be disproportionately affected by drug abuse, or face difficulties in accessing treatment.

According to the DALY indicator, which estimates the years of healthy life lost due to disability and premature death caused by addiction, the negative social impact has become more pronounced in the past 10 years.
From 2007 to 2018, the global number of disability-adjusted life years attributable to drug use increased by 17%.
Liver cancer-related disability-adjusted life years (DALYs) are particularly high in injecting drug users with untreated hepatitis C—40%.
The links between drugs and violence are complex and it is difficult to determine the causal relationships between all the factors involved in the use of psychotropic substances and violence.
Limited global data suggest that intoxication may be an important factor in murder.
However, in violent incidents, alcohol seems to play a greater role than drugs.

Although drug abuse may lead to crime, in some cases, the connection can be partly attributed to a variety of mediating factors, such as socioeconomic disadvantage, as well as other types of adversity caused by individual risk factors, family environment, and peers.
The link between drug trafficking and violence is multifaceted.
If there is a stable criminal structure, including international drug trafficking, large-scale organized crime may be carried out without violence.

In the short term, the presence and intensity of violence is not determined by the amount of drug trafficking, but rather by certain changes in the balance of power between organized criminal groups, such as changes in the size of the illegal market, the death or imprisonment of a notorious criminal, and enforcement measures that weaken one group relative to another.
最新趨勢
Marijuana is the most commonly used substance, and opioids cause the most harm.
It is estimated that 1.92 billion people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used drug globally.
In comparison, 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
However, the related dangers of opioids are often overlooked because of their limited use.

In the estimated 167,000 deaths related to drug use disorders in 2017, 66% were caused by these substances, and in the estimated 210 million years of life lost due to disabilities or premature death attributed to drug use, 50% were caused by these substances.
The non-medical use of synthetic opioids has exacerbated the public health crisis.

In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, tramadol exacerbates the opioid crisis; in North America, it is fentanyl. These regions have little in common in terms of economic, demographic, or drug use statistics, but are struggling to cope with the opioid crisis fueled by easily accessible and cheap substances.
In North America, the use of fentanyl and other synthetic opioids has led to a significant increase in overdose deaths from opioids over the past 20 years.
In 2018, 32.5 percent of overdose deaths in the United States involved fentanyl.
Canada also reported similar figures, but in lower numbers.
Part of the reason for fentanyl-related overdose deaths is the unpredictable potency of fentanyl on the illicit drug market.
The market for non-medical use of tramadol has grown substantially in West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa.
In 2017, the global seizure of tramadol peaked at over 125 tons.
However, after a new law was passed in India in 2018 regulating tramadol, global seizures fell to 32 tons in 2018.

The crisis in these two regions was caused by the simple manufacturing process and low production costs, as well as the lack of international regulation of tramadol and many fentanyl analogues or precursors.

These efforts facilitated the prevention of diversion of narcotic drugs and psychotropic substances into illicit traffic. This facilitated the worsening of the crisis in these regions, as these substances are supplied in the legitimate and illicit markets, making it more difficult to detect and prevent their abuse.
Stimulants are becoming increasingly popular.
Amphetamine and methamphetamine are the main stimulants in the market, and their use is on the rise in their major markets.
Around 19 million people used cocaine in 2018, because cocaine is popular in North America and Western Europe.
About 27 million people used methamphetamine in 2018, with methamphetamine being the most commonly used type of ATS in both East and South-East Asia and North America.
According to the available data, the use of methamphetamine in these two regions has been expanding over the past 20 years.

In some markets, cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist, sometimes replacing each other, so that the use of one drug increases while the use of the other decreases, sometimes simultaneously increasing and decreasing to meet the needs of the same market.
COVID-19 increases the risk for intravenous drug users.
It is estimated that there are about 11.3 million people who inject drugs, and about 10% of them are infected with HIV due to injection drug use.
More than 1.6 million people who inject drugs have HIV and 5.5 million have Hepatitis C.
In 2017, there were about 585,000 deaths due to drug abuse, of which half were caused by liver disease caused by Hepatitis B, and most of the Hepatitis B sufferers were not receiving treatment.

The shortage of opioids caused by COVID-19 restrictions may lead to the use of alcohol or other easily available substances, such as benzodiazepines or synthetic opioids, or the mixing of opioids with synthetic drugs.
As some users switch to injecting or inject more frequently, there may be more harmful use patterns.

The EU Summit debated the refugee policy, and EU officials said that the reception process is stalled - China News
The EU summit is dominated by disputes over refugee policy. EU officials say that the process of receiving refugees is plagued by bottlenecks at every step.

According to the Global Times on February 10, EU leaders agreed at the latest EU summit to adopt stricter policies on illegal immigration, making it easier to expel illegal immigrants. This was announced by EU Commission President, Frans Timmermans.

According to reports, this move by the EU is a response to the increasingly serious illegal immigration problem in Europe. Today, the core issue in the EU is that the number of illegal immigrants who can ultimately be deported is very small.

According to the agenda, the EU leaders called for the Commission to "immediately mobilize a large amount of EU funds" to strengthen the external borders with the use of infrastructure and surveillance.
However, there is a disagreement among the European Union and its member countries over who should pay for the fencing costs.
Von der Leyen repeatedly stated that the EU would not be paying the costs.

However, some diplomats from member countries claimed that if the EU could share the costs of installing cameras, observation towers, and other infrastructure along the borderline, this would free up national budgets and speed up the construction process.

Euractiv, a European website, reported that EU officials acknowledged that every step of the refugee reception process is stalled, and that the limited capacity and overburdened refugee agencies of EU member states cannot stop the influx of "numerous" asylum requests, and that the EU's refugee reception system is in a near-permanent crisis.
According to the European Commission, the Schengen countries received more than 920,000 asylum applications in 2015, an increase of nearly half compared to the previous year.
At the same time, the EU recorded over 330,000 cases of illegal entry in 2017.
In this context, the summit also agreed to a "principle" under which EU member states could return illegal migrants to another member state based on a court ruling from another country.
Additionally, reports say that the EU leaders have agreed to "increase the use of the concept of security states", which will open the way for the EU to draw up a common list.
(Source: @EduardKovacs @softpedia)

Recently, the US-China "semiconductor war" has been upgraded. First, under US pressure, the Netherlands and Japan agreed to lift the export control on the equipment for semiconductor manufacturing from China; then, the media reported that the US government is considering cutting off all ties between US suppliers and Huawei, and banning US suppliers from providing any products to Huawei; the Biden administration is also preparing to issue an

In recent years, the United States has never ceased its attacks on China's "chips" development, on the one hand, it has been accurately targeting the semiconductor supply chain to China, on the other hand, it has been constructing a "de-Sinicization" semiconductor industry alliance to completely "outflank" China in the advanced semiconductor industry.

Whether it is to form a "technology alliance" with South Korea to attract it, or to form a "chip alliance" with South Korea, Japan, and Taiwan, or to establish a semiconductor "small circle" through the "four-way mechanism" of the "Indo-Pacific Economic Framework" and the "Quadrilateral Indo-Pacific Economic Framework", the United States is using the politicalization, alliance
However, the US's "chip war strategy" against China is also "injuring the enemy a thousand times, self-damaging eight hundred times."

Recently, the American chip manufacturing equipment supplier Lam Research announced that the company would lay off about 1,300 full-time employees and another 1,400 temporary employees due to the latest round of export restrictions on China's chip manufacturing equipment.

Global leader in lithography equipment, ASML Holding NV, recently warned that the prohibition of the export of semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China could lead to a rise in semiconductor prices.

According to US media, many American companies have been severely affected by the US government's unrestrained and heavy-handed crackdown on the chip and semiconductor industries, including electronic design automation tool developers, chip designers, semiconductor wafer manufacturing equipment producers, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The United States' so-called "suppression" of China's advanced semiconductor industry has dragged down the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain.
The semiconductor industry is a highly capital-intensive and highly knowledge-intensive industry, and has formed a tightly connected global semiconductor industry chain.

According to the estimates of experts, the entire production process of semiconductor products requires the crossing of national borders at least 70 times, and the entire process takes up to 100 days.

Although the U.S. semiconductor industry is strong in terms of its foundation, it is weak in terms of manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced processes, and is heavily dependent on the East Asian region.

Even though the United States has done everything it can to steer the advanced semiconductor supply chain toward regional development in its "closed circle," it is difficult to change the regional distribution and interdependence of the global semiconductor-related industries.
The United States is "reconfiguring" the semiconductor industry chain by "de-Sinicization," which has severely damaged the global semiconductor industry.
Chips are the core of the future industry, and the development of the chip industry depends on the joint participation of all countries around the world.

Over the past few years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, successively promulgating the "Innovation and Competition Act," the "2022 American Competition Act," and the "Chip and Science Act," using its technological hegemony to consolidate its technological superiority; it has intimidated its allies, coercing Intel, TSMC, and Samsung, among others,
In the short term, the United States has indeed created problems for China's semiconductor industry and related industries, and has gained real benefits.

However, in the long run, the U.S. is in a desperate situation. By suppressing China, it has forced China's chip industry to continuously break through, and has lost the huge Chinese market, which will greatly reduce the innovation drive and innovation capabilities of U.S. technology companies, and ultimately damage the development of the global semiconductor industry.
The first batch of individual retirement savings products went on sale, with the minimum duration of 60 days and the maximum duration of 360 days.
First-ever individual pension funds are available for investment.
7 products are available from the home institution, with the minimum duration being 360 days.
Personal retirement savings products are finally available.

On February 10, China Retirement Fund released the first batch of personal pension fund investment products. The seven personal pension fund investment products of ICBC Retail Fund, Agricultural Bank Retail Fund, and China Post Retail Fund were officially launched.

The "shelves" of individual pension accounts have finally been filled with four types of products: savings for individual pension, individual pension investment, individual pension insurance, and individual pension mutual funds.

According to the introduction, the first batch of personal pension savings products consisted of 7 pure-value-type open-end funds, of which 5 were newly launched products and 2 were continuing products. Except for one product that was a mixed-type product, the other 6 products were all fixed-income type products.

Beijing Youth Daily reporters saw that of the 5 new products, 4 were from GFIC, all of which were fixed-income products, with the shortest holding period being 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days respectively. The corresponding performance benchmarks (annualized) were 3.70 % - 4.20 %, 4.10 % -

The remaining new issue product is " China Post Savings Fund Additional Yili Hengji No. 1 with the shortest holding period of 1095 days ", which is also a fixed income product. It began to raise funds on February 10 and ended on February 19. The risk level is grade two.
Two ongoing products include one from Agricultural Bank of China "Ag Bank Innovation - Dynamic 360 Day People's Bank Renminbi Savings Plan", a mixed-type savings plan with a risk level of three.

The other ongoing product is "China Post Wealth Management Addi Yueh Li Heng Jing 365 Days 1" which is a fixed-income type product, and it started collecting on December 30, 2021, and officially started operating on January 4, 2022. The accumulated net value on February 8 was 1.0011.

According to the "Opinions of the State Council General Office on Promoting the Development of Individual Pension Funds", individual pension fund accounts can invest in financial products including bank deposits, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, and publicly-traded funds.

The first batch of retirement savings investment products will be launched, marking the start of the official ability of individual retirement savings investors to purchase investment products through their retirement savings accounts.

In November 2020, the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission issued the "Interim Measures for the Management of Individual Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Wealth Management Companies".

The regulations stipulate that participants can purchase individual retirement savings through individual retirement savings accounts, individual retirement savings products, individual retirement savings insurance products, and individual retirement savings publicly-traded fund products through their individual retirement savings accounts.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the State Administration of Taxation issued a notice clarifying that the individual pension insurance system would be implemented in Beijing, Tianjin, and Hebei Shijiazhuang, as well as in Jincheng, Xiongan New Area, and other 36 pilot cities and regions.

As of the end of 2022, the number of participants in the individual pension scheme was 19.54 million, the number of payers was 6.13 million, and the total amount of pension contributions was 142 billion yuan.
Previously, the banks participating in the trial only offered three types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension mutual funds.
With the inclusion of the personal pension investment products, how should investors choose?

The expert from the research and development department of ICBC said that compared with other personal pension products, the retirement savings products and personal pension savings products during the trial period have three characteristics in common.

First, it is stability, which means that our risk management systems are more robust, our investment strategies and ideas are more conservative, and our assets are managed by independent third parties.

2. Long-term nature: The term of the trial-run retirement funds is all over 5 years, and the term of the retirement funds to be issued next is at least 1 year, and it is encouraged to hold for 3 years or more.
Option 3: Affordability, the purchase threshold is as low as $1, and some are as low as $0.01. The management fee, custody fee, and other fees are also more affordable.

The fitness industry should overcome the vaccine credibility crisis - China News
A "big-time gym" has been hit by a "typhoon"?
Recently, the issue of members' rights protection in the famous fitness institution Zhikang Fitness Club has attracted public attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members discovered that their respective stores were not operating normally, and later, rumors about the closure of the institution and the runaway of its staff caused panic among the members, prompting the intervention of the Public Security and Social Security departments.

Finally, the relevant person in charge of the organization stepped forward to respond and promised to do their best to protect the legitimate rights and interests of employees and members, and the dispute was finally resolved.

Why, when some fitness centers’ individual branches were temporarily closed due to operational issues, the consumers could have waited patiently for the problems to be resolved, but instead, many of them felt that “something was amiss”?
The backdrop to the controversy surrounding the fitness club members' rights protection is a deeper-level problem with the industry's trust.
Traditional gyms in China generally adopt a prepaid model, and "making money from users who don't come" is the underlying logic behind their development.
Chinese: 通過預售會員卡獲取現金流，不斷開新店，看似能夠循環往復，實則寅吃卯糧，無法形成穩定的盈利模式。
Negative news about the fitness industry keeps appearing, and this is causing a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the perspective of the market, it is obviously a good business to open a gym.
Despite the ups and downs of this season, the fitness industry has always been a focus of capital.
Multiple data show that the consumption of sports and entertainment is rising, and the market is recovering.

Specifically speaking, in the fitness industry, as people's living standards continue to improve, the concept of a healthy lifestyle has become increasingly popular, which provides a great opportunity for the development of the fitness industry.
The more favorable the situation, the more important it is to focus on the quality of development.

However, individual institutions are overly optimistic about the fitness market after the recovery of consumer spending, just as they are emerging from the crisis, and are throwing all their financing into new store construction.

It is undeniable that in recent years, many institutions have withdrawn, and the industry has been reshuffled. This is a good opportunity for the strong enterprises to selectively increase their acquisition efforts and reorganize, and this is also a new opportunity.

However, in order to enter a positive cycle of development in the fitness market, and to take the path of sustained progress, the industry must change its traditional business model and operating strategy.
Only by building up the trust and security of consumers can we truly win the market and the future.
Instead of building new stores to grab the market, the fitness industry currently needs to focus on optimizing its services, and develop with high-quality growth to secure its users.
First, we must rely on service to retain customers.
Gyms are service-oriented businesses. Their essence is to focus on "user-centeredness" and to improve the quality of services by focusing on the upgrading of service quality.
Secondly, we need to improve user experience through digital transformation.
For example, the popular model of internet fitness centers, where users pay per visit and choose the location themselves.
At the same time, the body data and exercise data can be effectively utilized, and it can meet social needs, creating a complete service loop from online to offline.
There is no sales pitch from personal trainers, no expensive annual memberships, and users' concerns about leaving a gym are reduced, which also boosts trust.
In addition, multiple business models should be explored.

Today, fitness consumption has shifted from a single service to a scene-based consumption, and fitness clubs may become a new gateway for consumption. Around the needs of fitness, such as sports nutrition and fitness equipment, there may be new sources of profit, and consumers will have more choices.

The Nanjing real estate market has re-emerged with "price compensation" - China News

揚子晚報/紫牛新聞記者 馬祚波 (10th day) During an interview on the 10th, reporters discovered that the "price protection agreement", which had not been seen for over ten years, had reappeared in the Nanjing real estate market. A real estate project in the Nanjing New District claimed that "price compensation" was included in the
The terms of the "price guarantee agreement" are not few.
The apartment complex, named Yuan Tai in Yancheng District, is owned by Poly, and Mr. Sun, who visited the complex last weekend, told the reporter that he discovered a "notice" there.

The photo he sent to the reporter shows that the developer of this project promises that if the house is purchased between February 1 and February 28, the developer will pay the difference between the discounts of the corresponding house and the discounts of the previous house purchased (limited to houses of the same type, in the same building, in the same unit, and of the same property type) from the day the sales contract is signed until the house is delivered. The developer can

Sun Xun, the buyer, said that the real purpose of this "price guarantee agreement" is to make buyers feel at ease and not worry about developers offering discounts to promote sales. "I'm really worried that the price will drop after I buy it. I don't have time to go to the sales office to complain, so I'm just waiting and worrying that it will drop in price. It's a shame that I have to
There are also a lot of buyers who think that the "price protection agreement" is a "heart-warming" measure, but the conditions are not low.

Ms. Zheng, who is looking to buy a house in the Yangnan District, said that the "protected" properties must first be of the same type, in the same building, and in the same unit. As such, the "threshold" is quite high.
Some buyers also believe that the lack of information makes it difficult for them to "protect their rights", and that they may be offered additional discounts when the units are sold.
Whether it can retain buyers remains to be seen.

A reporter checked the online real estate market in Nanjing and found that the property for sale in this project consisted of 252 units in two buildings, with floor area ranging from 105 square meters to 129 square meters. The average selling price of the fully furnished units was RMB 39,843 per square meter.

However, more than two months have passed since then, and online real estate shows that the total number of units still unsold in the project is 157, with a ratio of 62.3%, with 80% of the units in building 8 still unsold, and building 7 has 44 unsold units, accounting for only 13% of the total number of transactions.
Market participants explained that "protection agreements" had also been seen in Nanjing in 2008.

In August 2020, the housing project Huangshan Road, located in Huxi District, launched the "Price Protection Plan", which stated that the company would "pay back the difference to old homeowners if the discount rate of the project increases within a year." The specific content was "the company solemnly pledges that, if the discount rate increases within a year, the company will pay back the difference to old homeowners."
In April 2011, nine apartment complexes in Nanjing also made a commitment to pay "price differentials" for a portion of their inventory.
The market is warming up, so it needs a “stimulant” now more than ever.
According to Mr. Shen, a senior property manager in Nanjing, the "protection pricing agreement" is also one of the marketing methods of property developers.
He believes that developers need more confidence than buyers do, and the "protection agreement" is a way to give them a boost.
Whether or not they will be able to keep the buyers around is dependent on a number of factors, including the regulatory policies, interest rates, and so on. It is still too early to tell.
Multiple economic indicators decline, Taiwan's economy starts the year off poorly - China News Service
Expert analysis suggests that Taiwan's economy is off to a bad start this year, with growth pressure not small.

According to the Finance Administration Department of the Taiwan authorities, the exports of Taiwan region in January this year were 31.51 billion US dollars, down 21.2%, for 5 consecutive months of negative growth.
All 11 major export categories saw a decline in exports compared with the same period last year.
Plastic rubber and its products, as well as optical instruments, declined the most, falling 37.6% and 35.7% respectively.
The export of electronic components fell by 20.1% year-on-year, the largest decline in 11 years.
Among them, integrated circuits fell 18.3% year-on-year, the largest decline in 14 years.
Chief of the Department of Statistics, Cai Mengna, said that this indicates that the demand for consumer electronics is weakening, and that the electronic industry is entering a period of correction.
According to statistics, in January, Taiwan's imports and exports both fell, with imports totaling only 23.4 billion US dollars, the lowest level in the past three years.

The Taiwanese government’s finance administration department believes that global demand has decreased, and the industry is adjusting inventory to dampen suppliers’ desire to purchase materials, which is suppressing the export slump in the short term, and Taiwan’s first-quarter export decline is likely to be higher than expected.

According to the Chung-Hua Institution for Economic Research in Taiwan, the manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) in Taiwan for January, adjusted for seasonality, was 40.4%, down 3.3 percentage points from the previous month, and has been contracting for seven consecutive months.
In the economic monitoring system, the PMI is set at 50% as the threshold of recession. If the PMI is above 50%, it indicates an expansion of the economy, and the opposite indicates contraction.
The five sub-indices for the PMI in Taiwan in January showed a contraction in new orders, production and employment, and a decline in supplier delivery time, while inventory contraction was evident.

All the industries except for the power and mechanical equipment industry (35.1%) and the electronic and optical industry (35.2%) returned to a contraction. The industries were ranked in order of contraction speed based on the contraction speed, with the chemical and biotechnology medical industry (39.2%), the basic raw material industry (42.4%), the transportation industry (42.6%), and the food and textile

In terms of prices, the Directorate General of Budget, Accounting and Statistics of the Executive Yuan announced that the CPI inflation rate in Taiwan in January was 3.04%, the highest since July 2017.
Among them, vegetable prices have risen by 28.25%, a new high in 17 months.

The Special Advisor to the Directorate General of the "Main Administration of Statistics, Taiwan," Chao Zhigong, admitted that the increase in vegetable prices was indeed greater than expected, excluding the impact of the Spring Festival, the average CPI for January and February should be close to the 2.71 percent of December 2017, and inflation pressure remains high and is still at a high point.
Taiwan's economy in 2022: an expert says that the outlook is pessimistic based on reports from the island's media, such as "Yahoo Finance" and "The United Daily News".

Professor Wu Daren of the Economics Department at Central University in Taiwan analyzed that the export slump could lead to cash flow problems for export manufacturers, and debt default risks would rise.
At the same time, the decline in orders leads to a reduction in the cost of labor, which affects the labor market and the family economy, and in turn impacts consumer spending.

Chu Ta-sheng, a research fellow at the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, believes that the inflation situation in Europe and the United States has not been resolved, and demand continues to contract. He estimates that the export slump in Taiwan will continue through the first half of the year.
As Taiwan's economy relies heavily on exports, it is susceptible to the impact of sluggish exports, which will affect its economic growth performance this year.

Report: The number of students returning to China to seek employment and study in 2022 has reached a new high - China News Network
The report states that the number of returnees seeking employment in China has increased significantly since 2020, and the number of recent graduates seeking employment in China has also increased.
Compared to 2021, the number of recent graduates seeking employment in China increased by 8.6% in 2022, and the number of return-to-China students increased to a new high.

From the distribution of countries of origin for returning home to seek employment graduates, the UK has the highest share, at 41.4%, followed by Australia (20.3%) and the US (9%), which is consistent with the 2021 distribution.

From the perspective of year-on-year growth, the number of recent graduates from Malaysia, Japan, and Singapore increased significantly, with year-on-year growth rates of 66.1%, 50.9%, and 37.7%, respectively.
The number of recent graduates from Canada, Germany, USA, and Australia decreased by comparison.

The employment demand and supply situation of returnees after the Spring Festival in 2023 is shown in the first week of the following week. Source: China Seas Survey Report on the Employment of Returnees in 2022

A survey shows that 58% of those who decided to return home considered that "life is more convenient in the home country", 40% because "they are more in tune with the cultural environment in the home country", 32% because "there are more job opportunities in the home country", and 22% because "the economic recovery in the home country will be accelerated, and there will be more job opportunities."
According to the data, the demand for overseas talent by domestic enterprises is rapidly released, and the demand for returnees is on the rise.

In terms of industry, the education/training industry has the highest number of priority jobs for overseas graduates, with 27.8%, followed by professional services/consulting and Internet/e-commerce industries, with 14.3% and 11.1%, respectively.
The number of people who have returned to China to find jobs has changed in recent years.

From salary, the average recruitment salary for the top priority positions for returning overseas Chinese has continued to rise for three consecutive years, reaching 14,680 yuan/month (RMB) in 2022, an increase of 961 yuan/month from 2021, an increase of 7%.

From the perspective of regions, the desire of the Haiers to develop in first-tier cities, second-tier cities, and third- and fourth-tier cities has increased in 2022, and the proportion of applications in 2022 was 31%, 15.7%, and 14.3%, respectively, all higher than the proportion in 2021.
For the benefits of studying abroad, 52.7% of the Huaqiao respondents said they were basically in line with their expectations, up 2.8 percentage points from last year (49.9%).

Shenzhen: Create the first and the most advanced city of Extreme Speed Leaders in China and the world - China News Service

China News Service, February 11 - The Shenzhen Municipal Bureau of Industry and Information Technology issued the "Action Plan for the Construction of Shenzhen as a Super Fast Forward City" on February 10.

According to the agreement, by the end of 2023, super-high-speed, large-capacity, low-latency broadband networks will be built, and the goal of “dual gigabits, full optical fiber, 1 microsecond, and everything connected” will be achieved. This will help build the world's first and the country's first "ultra-fast, ultra-large, ultra-low latency,
The plan proposes to accelerate the upgrade to Gigabit fiber optic network.
By the end of 2023, 10G PON ports will account for 100%, and the number of all-optical industrial parks (industrial parks) will exceed 100.
The plan requires a full upgrade of 5G network energy efficiency.
Research and develop standards and regulations for the quality of 5G network services, conduct 5G network testing and evaluation, and improve the quality of 5G network services.

Support telecommunications companies to enhance the optimization of 5G networks in key areas and locations, and to add 10,000 5G base stations throughout the year. Average download speeds in major areas will reach 500 Mbps, and upload speeds will reach 100 Mbps. Download speeds in key areas will reach 1 Gbps, and upload speeds will reach 200 Mbps.
Create high-quality city-level wireless LANs.

Establish a service standard for public WLANs in public places, and promote the upgrade of WLANs in areas where large numbers of people and information consumption are concentrated. Provide 1 Gbps access capability.

We will build a unified management platform for wireless local area networks in the city, based on the "Deepi" platform, to enable "one-time authentication, seamless roaming, and intelligent switching," and support operators to include publicly service-capable social APs (wireless access points) in the certification management platform.
By the end of 2023, the total number of upgraded APs should be at least 20,000.

In addition, the Plan also proposes the construction of a high-quality, all-optical transport network, the construction of a multi-layered computing capacity supply system, the acceleration of key communication network infrastructure construction, and the improvement of Internet application service capabilities.
The plan clarifies that the collaborative construction of a smart sensing system is necessary.

The city's sensing terminal construction management model based on the "OpenHarmony" operating system shall be explored. The cost of interconnection shall be reduced, and the construction of city-level sensing terminals shall be accelerated, in order to promote the interconnection of various professional sensing terminals and city-level sensing networks, as well as the interconnection of data.

Deepen the application of smart sensing in urban management, public services, public security, and transportation, and expand the collection channels of fixed sensing and smart networked vehicles, for example, in the areas of roads, buildings, and public facilities.

By the end of 2023, there will be more than 9 million smart lampposts for electricity, water, gas, and Internet of Things sensors, and 20 pilot projects will be built to demonstrate their application.
The plan also mentions strengthening the integration of satellite and ground communications, setting up a low-orbit network infrastructure, and promoting the coverage of 5G networks in the sea.

At the same time, China Mobile Hong Kong is promoting the development of 5G networks in the sea, creating an innovative development ecosystem, and supporting the holding of top-level events and activities.
China's e-commerce industry is experiencing "new variables", how to do "content is king" when delivering goods?
China News Service 2/11/2021 - Theme: How Can Online Merchants Make "Content King" in the New Era of Chinese E-commerce?
" We entered the e-commerce market late, but from the very beginning we realized that to stand out from among the thousands of stores, content is crucial.
" Fangying, a "90s girl" from Guangdong, now operates an online health food shop on Douyin, where she is helping a shop with more than 30 years of history "go online" and "bloom."

Simulating the film style of old Hong Kong movies and using classic Cantonese songs, opening the TikTok account of @Fang Fang, who is one person, a video with a beautiful setting was created, which was very novel.

At the recent TikTok e-commerce "Seeking Peers and Sharing Quality Content" event, Fangying, as a representative of quality content creators, gave a speech and shared her experiences and insights on a daily basis.

She said at the event: "Videos that are carefully crafted and edited receive a lot of attention from netizens. A lot of people are interested in the ingredients I use, and they want to make the same dishes with me. This has opened up a lot of sales channels for us.

Fang Xiang, a 27-year-old girl from Guangdong, made a video of her cooking soup and gained many fans, which led to her selling 300,000 units of healthy foods in a single live-streaming session. This saved her grandmother's 30-year-old store from going bankrupt.
"Without content, there is no e-commerce," as the short video and live-streaming e-commerce continue to develop, people's requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new phase.

At the beginning of live streaming shopping development, live broadcasting rooms often used low-priced discounts to attract users. It seemed that price advantage was the only selling point at the time.

In recent years, there are both phenomenal-level big Vs, such as Liu Yiying and Oriental Selection, and also many little-known personalities and merchants who have emerged in the vertical sub-sectors, they are continuously creating high-quality content in accordance with their own brand characteristics, which has improved their long-term operating efficiency.

According to the operation manager of Doushi Commerce, Guo Yajian, in the past year, 6.27 million creators used Douyin to monetize their content, and their content creation volume grew by 252%, and their total transaction volume also increased by more than 100%.
Behind these numbers, we can feel the vibrant and dynamic ecosystem of authors who are full of life and vigorous.

The Beijing Normal University Communication Innovation and Future Media Experimental Platform recently released the "ECHI Report on the Health of the Content Ecosystem in the E-Commerce Industry," which analyzed the importance of "new variables"—quality content—from a data perspective. The index was used to evaluate the content ecosystems of 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the "ECHI" ranking of the content ecosystem health of the e-commerce industry in the report, Tik Tok, Douyin, Taobao, Pinduoduo, and JD.com rank in the top five.

The report considers the ecosystem of commercial content in the e-commerce industry as a comprehensive concept, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce. Good PGC (professional content production) and UGC (user-generated content) are the quality carriers for integrating with e-commerce. The more valuable the content platform, the more diverse the consumption and promotion scenarios will be, and the possibility of e-commerce integration will also increase, which will strengthen
At the scene, Professor Ye Guoming of the School of Journalism and Communication at Peking University made an analysis and interpretation of the report.

He said that from the perspective of content value, the current e-commerce industry has moved from the "accessibility of consumption" to the "quality-oriented consumption" stage, and high-quality, professional, differentiated content is the "hard currency" of the e-commerce industry.

In addition, content has become the fundamental and handle of the new development stage of e-commerce, and PGC content such as paid content, professional knowledge, KOL (key opinion leaders) and the like has become the standard in e-commerce live broadcasts.
Looking ahead to the future development of the e-commerce industry, Cui Guoming made two suggestions.

From the perspective of content structure improvement, push for the overall improvement of health and quality of the e-commerce content ecology, establish positive content creation and management standards, and achieve a dynamic balance in the e-commerce industry content ecology health index and dynamic equilibrium.

From another perspective, the external ecology should be used to achieve the healthy development and value coordination of the content e-commerce industry, as well as the co-creation of the external environment.

" In the future, the Internet commerce industry will require more support from data and artificial intelligence in terms of stability, and this will form a forecast of future development stability. In addition, it will provide more regulated and healthy growth space for merchants, and will achieve the value cooperation of enterprises, users, products, and services in the Internet commerce industry, and create a healthy content ecosystem. "

China's rescue team has continued its rescue operations in Turkey, where 4 people have been rescued so far - China News Service

China News Service, February 11 - According to the website of the Ministry of Emergency Management, on February 10, the Chinese rescue team that was searching in Turkey sent out three search and rescue teams and 45 rescue team members to rescue one person who was trapped.
At the same time, two search and assessment teams were sent out to assess and inspect 15 buildings on Vodabashi Street.
As of now, a total of four people have been rescued, five bodies have been recovered, and 25 buildings with severe damage have been inspected for signs of life and risk assessment.
The rescue team will adjust the rescue force according to the actual situation in the disaster area and the rescue site conditions, and will continue to carry out rescue work in a scientific manner.

The rescue team obtains information on rescue requests through various channels, such as embassies, local governments, and the United Nations rescue organization, and verifies them through online inquiries and on-site searches.
Introduce the current rescue environment and the collapse of buildings to the China Hong Kong Rescue Team, and jointly conduct search operations.

The rescue team continued to strengthen safety management and team protection. In accordance with the principle of "unity of command, safety first", it strengthened the safety control at the rescue site and enhanced the discipline and safety requirements for rescue work. It also clearly stated the safety issues to be paid attention to.
A rotating shift system and sentry duty system are in place, and the camp site is subject to strict security management.

The medical staff of the rescue squad provides daily health check services for the team members, and they strengthen the medical protection of key personnel, and the entire rescue squad is currently healthy. They are conducting disinfection and sanitization in the camp.

After setting up the base camp, the logistics support team built 4 types of 26 tents for command, communication, equipment storage, medical hygiene, living and dormitory, and kennel, which ensured the equipment of the field rescue site of more than 30 sets.

(Deutsche Welle Chinese website) The Biden administration listed six Chinese entities suspected of involvement in the spy balloon program on Friday, February 10.

The U.S. Department of Commerce said that these five Chinese companies and one research institution have helped modernize the Chinese military, particularly in the aerospace and naval fields, including submarines and aircraft.
Companies on the blacklist have a hard time obtaining US technology exports.
The list is called the "entity list," and companies on it are not allowed to purchase technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they obtain special export licences from the Commerce Department.

The companies on the blacklist are: Beijing Nanjiang Aerospace and Electronic Technology Co Ltd, Institute 48 of the 48th Research Institute of China Electronics Technology Group Corporation, Linghao Remote Sensing Technology Co Ltd, Yongmen Aerospace Technology Group Co Ltd, Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Hai Aerospace Technology Co Ltd, and Shanxi Yongmen Aerospace Technology Group Co
Before this, the White House said it was considering broader measures, including "monitoring and handling" the threat posed by China to the security of the United States.
The balloon incident has further escalated tensions between the US and China, and US Secretary of State, Blinken, canceled his visit to China.

The U.S. bombed a balloon on February 4, and the Chinese government issued a formal protest to the U.S. embassy in China, criticizing the U.S. for seriously undermining and damaging the efforts and progress of stabilizing the Sino-U.S. relations.

Based on the evidence of existing debris and information from China's military procurement platform, the US government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon had "direct ties" to the People's Liberation Army and was an approved supplier to the Chinese military.

Mao Ning, spokesman of the Chinese Foreign Ministry, said at a press conference on Friday that regarding the accidental intrusion of a Chinese unmanned aircraft into the U.S. airspace due to force majeure, China has already made multiple explanations and clarifications.
According to the Foreign Ministry website, she added that the resolutions of the U.S. Congress are purely political manipulation and pandering.
China is strongly dissatisfied with this and firmly opposed to it.

Assistant Secretary Matthew Axelrod of the Commerce Department, which is responsible for export enforcement, said: "Today's action shows that we have made a joint effort to identify and stop the use of espionage balloons that violate the airspace of the United States and over 40 other countries.
Reuters reported that a staff member at Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd. said he was unaware of the sanctions and declined to comment further.
The Chinese embassy in the United States and the information has not yet been commented on.

(Deutschlandradio Kultur) It has been several days since the earthquakes hit parts of Turkey and Syria, and the hope of finding survivors is fading, but the rescue of a family of five on Saturday has left the search teams overjoyed.
According to the Associated Press, the Party of Five from the devastated town of Nurdağı in Gaziantep Province were rescued after being trapped for five days and more in the rubble.
Rescuers first pulled out the mother and daughter from a pile of rubble, and then found the father, but he insisted that they first rescue his son and another daughter.
After they were all rescued, the crowd erupted in cheers.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaraş, in severe cold weather conditions, a 16-year-old boy and an elderly woman were successfully rescued.
"What day is it today?"
——After being rescued from the rubble after being trapped there for 129 hours, the 10-year-old boy asked the rescuers, "What day is it?"
A man from Kahramanmaras holds his newly rescued cat
Miraculous success stories of rescue have brought a ray of hope to the previously hopeless search and rescue efforts, but at the same time, the number of victims is on the rise.
According to official statistics, the earthquake that occurred on Monday has killed more than 20,000 people in Turkey and more than 3,500 in neighboring Syria.
Experts say that a person can survive for up to a week after being trapped in the rubble, but the prospects of finding more survivors are becoming increasingly bleak.
Rescuers are still using thermal imaging to search for signs of life in the ruins.
At the same time, the focus of the rescue work shifts to helping the people who need to be rescued the most.
The disaster in this region is "once in a century" for the UN officials.

At a press conference in Turkey, Martin Griffiths, the United Nations Under Secretary General for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief Coordinator, said that this earthquake was the "worst disaster in this region in a hundred years."
He also praised Turkey's response to the disaster as "unprecedented."
He also told Reuters that he hoped to be able to provide aid to the areas controlled by the Syrian government and the opposition, but added that the situation was "not clear" at this point.
The United Nations has pledged an additional $25 million in relief aid to the victims of the earthquake in Syria.
Earlier this week, the United Nations announced a funding of $25 million for relief efforts in Turkey and Syria.
The most destructive earthquake in recent global history occurred 60 years ago.
Chile, Pacific Rim, 1960 earthquake
At 3:11 p.m. local time on May 22, 1960, a magnitude 9.5 earthquake occurred in Valdivia, Chile, which was the largest recorded earthquake in terms of seismic moment.
In a matter of minutes, the entire city of Valdivia was reduced to rubble.
The most destructive earthquake in recent times occurred 60 years ago.
The Alaska Good Friday earthquake
On March 27, 1964, it was a Friday, also the day of the crucifixion of Jesus.
On this day, a major earthquake occurred in Alaska, USA, which was the largest earthquake ever recorded in North America, with a moment magnitude of 9.2.
Until 2006, the Alaska earthquake was still the third largest earthquake in recorded history.
When an earthquake occurs, a fault in the Pacific plate and the North American plate near Prince William Sound breaks.
The earthquake lasted for three to five minutes in most areas.
The sea floor shifted and triggered a tsunami, with a height of 67 meters.
Because it was a holiday, schools and many businesses were closed.
The earthquake ultimately claimed the lives of 139 people.
Nine people died directly as a result of the earthquake, and the other 130 died as a result of the tsunami caused by the earthquake.
The most destructive earthquake in recent times occurred 60 years ago.
The Tangshan earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two powerful earthquakes of magnitude 7 or above occurred within 16 hours in Tangshan city and Fengnan County in Hebei Province, China.
The epicenter is 23 km deep.
The entire city of Tangshan was left without transportation, communications, water supply, and electricity, and was flattened in an instant.
The capital Beijing, 140 km away, also experienced strong earthquake tremors.
According to official statistics, including Beijing and Tianjin, all areas affected by the disaster suffered a total of 2,427,690 deaths and 1,648,510 injuries.
The Tangshan earthquake is the second-deadliest earthquake in China's history, after the Shaanxi earthquake of 1556.
However, foreign scientists estimate that this earthquake could have killed at least 650,000 people.
The most destructive earthquake in recent times occurred 60 years ago.
Indian Ocean Earthquake (2004)
On December 26, 2004, an earthquake with a magnitude of 9.1 to 9.3 occurred 160 kilometers off the west coast of Aceh province in Indonesia, with a depth of 30 kilometers.
The tsunami was as high as 15 to 30 meters.

The Pacific coastline was affected by 14 countries in total, the most seriously affected areas being Aceh province in Indonesia, Phuket and the Thai resort areas, Sri Lanka and Tamil Nadu state in India.
According to estimates, the number of the dead and missing is at least 300,000.
The most destructive earthquakes in the past 60 years occurred globally.
On 12 May 2008, a major earthquake occurred in Wenchuan, in Sichuan Province, China.

According to data from the China Earthquake Administration, the surface wave magnitude of this earthquake was 8.2 and the moment magnitude was 8.3, with the affected area exceeding 100,000 square kilometers.

Up to September 25, 2008, the great earthquake had killed 69,227 people, 17,923 were missing, 374,643 were injured, 19,930,030 people lost their homes, and the total population affected was 46,256,000.
It is also the most destructive earthquake in the People's Republic of China since its establishment, and one of the most serious casualties after the earthquake in Tangshan.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12 would be designated as National Disaster Prevention and Reduction Day, with the aim of educating the public and paying more attention to disaster prevention and reduction work.
Afterwards, governments and primary and secondary schools in various parts of China held an earthquake drill on this day every year.
Schools are now also paying attention to the popularization of "earthquake prevention and mitigation" education.
The most destructive earthquake in the past 60 years occurred in the world.
On January 12, 2010, the Caribbean island nation of Haiti was hit by an earthquake with a magnitude of 7.0.
The epicenter was located 25 kilometers west-southwest of the capital Port-au-Prince, at a depth of about 13 kilometers.
The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies estimated that as many as 3 million people had been affected by the quake.
The official death toll is over 200,000.
In some areas of Haiti, up to 90% of the houses were destroyed by the earthquake.

Although the international community has provided a great deal of assistance and support, this impoverished country plagued by overpopulation and corruption has never recovered from the devastation caused by this disaster.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world over the past 60 years occurred:
The 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami in Japan's Tōhoku region.
On 11 March 2011, a large megathrust earthquake occurred in the ocean off the Tōhoku region of Japan with a magnitude of 9.0 on the Richter scale.

The epicenter was located in the Pacific Ocean, east of Sendai City in Miyagi Prefecture, with the earthquake having a focus depth of 24 km and triggering a tsunami with a maximum runup height of 40.1 m.
This earthquake was the first of its magnitude over 9 to be recorded in Japan.
Approximately 22,000 people died in the disaster, and about 400,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant was affected by an earthquake and tsunami and there was a leakage of radioactive substances.
This incident was classified as the most serious event on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES), with a rating of 7.
The Fukushima nuclear accident resulted in the widespread measurement of trace amounts of radioactive substances, including iodine-131 and caesium-137 (half-lives of 8 and 30 years respectively).
A large amount of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific as a result of the nuclear accident.
According to the United Nations, at least 870,000 people in the disaster areas of Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan are in urgent need of food.
Just in Syria alone, over 5.3 million people lost their homes due to the earthquake.
The World Food Program called for $77 million in funding to provide food for the millions of people in Turkey and Syria who have been displaced by the earthquake.
At the moment, the temperature in the disaster area is as low as minus 30 degrees Celsius. Many of the victims do not have a place to stay.
The Turkish government distributed a large amount of hot meals, tents, and blankets, but these materials are still difficult to distribute to many people in need of assistance.
In Syria, where the civil war has lasted for 12 years, the earthquake only added to the misery of the people.
Four days after the earthquake, WFP had already provided food aid to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) also sent 72 tons of medical supplies for the treatment of wounds and emergency surgery.

NEWS GOV-MO: POLICE WARNING: Citizens Urged to Beware Fake Telecommunications Company Text Scams

Recently, the police force received several cases of telecommunication fraud. Illegal operators pretended to be the telecommunication companies in Macao and sent fraudulent text messages with website links to victims, in order to trick them into exchanging rewards before the deadline and lure them into visiting fake websites to redeem their rewards.

The victim entered the card details and verification code as instructed, and received a notification from the financial institution that the card had an unknown purchase record. They suspected that the card details had been stolen from the above website.
It has been confirmed that the telecommunications company did not send the aforementioned SMS messages.

The Police Force urges the public to be vigilant if they receive similar text messages, and not to click on the links contained in the text messages or to provide any personal information; if they are asked to provide their credit card information, account transaction passwords, or transaction verification codes, they should be doubly careful, and take precautions to prevent their credit cards from being stolen.
1. Pay more attention to internet security information and increase personal awareness;
2. Do not log into unknown websites carelessly and register your personal and credit card information on the websites, in order to prevent your information from being stolen;
3. Be wary of fake websites and fishing websites, and always check whether the website URL is completely in line with the official website;
Install and update anti-virus and anti-spyware software on your mobile phones, computers, and other mobile devices regularly.
If you suspect you are being scammed or involved in any other crime, you should immediately call the police anti-fraud hotline at 8800 7777 or the emergency hotline at 993 for assistance.
