Google AI's chatbot "made a mistake in answering a question" and the company's stock value evaporated by billions of dollars on August 7th.

Google's new artificial intelligence chatbot Bard has been a flop in its promotional video, where it "got the answer wrong" and caused Google parent company Alphabet's stock to plunge by 8.9% on Thursday, hitting a low of $94.57, wiping out $110 billion (about RM47.65 billion) in market value (as of Friday's close).
The market is concerned that Alphabet will not be able to keep up with its competitor Microsoft.

According to a report by Reuters, Google earlier released a promotional video for its AI chatbot Bard on social media, in which a person asked Bard: "What are the new discoveries about the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) that I can tell my 9-year-old child about?"
In answering the question, Bard mentioned that the telescope had captured the first image of an extrasolar planet.

However, according to the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, the first photo of an extrasolar planet was taken by the "Extremely Large Telescope" of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
The news agency Reuters reported the story under the title "Alphabet plunges after Bard's botched answer."

On the other hand, Google pointed out that Bard's response "highlights the importance of rigorous testing procedures," and will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's responses meet high standards for quality, safety, and truthfulness.

Fund E Accounts Are Here: The Securities Regulatory Commission Authorizes Development, and Investors Can Now Access All Funds Held in Their Names - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Economic Observer reporter Chen Xiang believes that the complex fund-purchasing channels make it difficult to collect account information.

These problems will also be solved for retail investors.
On February 10, the SFC announced that the "Fund E Account" app was available for download from various mobile app stores and undergoing public testing.

According to the introduction, the "Fund E Account" is a "one-stop" service for investors to query information about public fund accounts and shares. It is aimed at solving the pain points of the industry, such as forgetting the account and the cumbersome process of querying.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there were 156 domestic public fund management institutions, with the total fund management scale of about 2.6 trillion yuan; there were 167 public fund registration institutions, and 411 public fund sales institutions.
Each registration agency has its own account system, which lacks a unified channel for querying.
Industry insiders say that at the end of 2021, there were over 720 million fund investors in China, which means that half of the country's population invested in fund products.

Before, investors had to check their purchase history with different sales channels, but with "Fund E Account", they can check all purchase information across all sales channels, and they can clearly see their holdings.
What is the "基金E賬戶" APP?

According to the related documents, "Fund E Account" APP is a mobile application developed and built by the China Clearing and Settlement Center, approved by the China Securities Regulatory Commission, which can provide a one-stop query service for the holdings of public fund products outside the market for investors.

Through the "基金E賬戶" application, investors can conveniently and quickly monitor the holdings of all mutual fund products they have purchased through various sales channels in the market, thereby greatly enhancing the efficiency of their queries.

Specifically speaking, the information that investors can check through "the Fund E Account" includes: information about the fund account opened at all fund management companies in the market, information about the trading account opened at the fund sales agency, and information about the holdings of products such as open-end publicly-traded securities investment funds and securities companies established for the purpose of managing investors' assets, which are not subject to a limit of 20

Liu Yichuan, the head of the Shanghai Stock Fund Rating Research Center, told Economic Observer that investors can learn about their holdings of all off-exchange mutual funds through the "FundE Account" App, which will help them regain "lost assets," and more importantly, the app will help investors to aggregate and consolidate all of their mutual fund investment information in a timely, accurate, and complete manner, thereby helping
How to register for API?

Journalists have noticed that the "fund E account" App has been available in the application stores of Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, and vivo, but it is still in the trial phase, and users need to fill in an invitation code to register. Investors can contact the fund management company that holds the fund to obtain it.

A reporter for Economic Observer gave me a six-digit invitation code, and told me that "every fund manager is given a certain number of invitation codes by China Clearing, and investors can call to get them. We will provide them."
After the trial period is over, users no longer need to use the invitation code to register.

Based on the information disclosed on the website of the China Securities Regulatory Commission, the reporter downloaded and used the "Fund E Account" registration instructions and completed the registration and query process within a few minutes. The process consisted of four steps: user registration, real name authentication, fund account binding, and public fund query.

After the verification step, click the "Fund Assets" button to bind the fund, and all funds purchased through the various fund sales platforms will appear in the list of binding options (which can be bound to the account). After binding, the total assets of the invested funds can be seen clearly, and the query function can be used immediately.
It is worth noting that the "Fund E Account" only provides query services to investors and does not allow for redemption and buying and selling transactions.
The data displayed by "Fund E Account" generally shows the number of transactions per user three days before the date of the user's query (T day).

For example, on February 10, when you open the "Fund E Account", the total assets, fund shareholdings, and fund net asset value corresponding to that date are three trading days earlier, i.e., February 7.

Asia – On February 9, President Bongbong Marcos of the Philippines visited Japan and met with Prime Minister Kishida Fumio.

The two leaders agreed to oppose China's intrusion into the South China Sea and the East China Sea and to sign a three-way defense agreement with the United States to strengthen practical defense cooperation and oppose China's hegemonic policy. They released a joint statement after the meeting stating that this would be done through the signing of a three-way defense agreement with the United States.
According to Japanese media, Kishida hoped that this meeting would help establish policies between Japan and the Philippines to deal with the crisis in the Taiwan Strait.
Marcos visited China in January and signed a deal worth $20 billion.
However, relations between the two bodies haven't improved much since then.

At the beginning of this month, the Philippines and the United States signed an agreement, agreeing to allow the US military to set up more bases in the Philippines and to ensure the security of the South China Sea.
One of the new bases is located 300 kilometres from Taiwan, which is the closest location to China.
If Taiwan were to face a crisis, the US military may take action from the bases in the Philippines.

According to Japanese media, now Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, and the Philippines, as well as the United States, form a core, and the "counter-Communist line" is being built in the West Pacific to promote regional cooperation.
Andrew Hsia, Vice Chairman of the Kuomintang Party, delivered the message that the green camp is welcome to visit the mainland under the 92 Consensus.
The Vice Chairperson of the Kuomintang of Taiwan, Andrew Hsia, met with both CNSA Director Song Tao and Standing Committee member Wang Huning of the CPC Central Committee during his visit to China.

Chao Chun-shan, a senior advisor of the KMT official organization, the National Policy Foundation, was interviewed by Taiwan Central News Agency last night. He gave a positive evaluation of the remarks made by Sung Tao, saying that if you accept the "92 Consensus" and oppose Taiwan independence, China will welcome Green Party members to visit the mainland.
The Nationalist Party considers it to be a fresh event.
Daw Aung San Suu Kyi did not mention this statement during her meeting with Cao Dong earlier today.
The ruling party in Taiwan, the Democratic Progressive Party, has been clarifying that it does not accept the "ninety-two consensus."

According to Central News Agency today, the Vice Chairman of the Chinese Nationalist Party, Xia Liying, led a delegation to visit China. During their stay in Beijing, they met with Wang Huning, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee, and the newly appointed Director of the Taiwan Affairs Office, Song Tao, as well as with the Secretary General of the Beijing Municipal Committee, Yin Liqun.

During the meeting with Song Tao, Xia Li-jun pointed out that the political foundation of the KMT and CCP is the 92 Consensus and anti-Taiwan independence. Zhao Chun-shan, the senior advisor of the Nationalist Party's National Policy Foundation, also said during the meeting that the KMT's 92 Consensus is the real 92 Consensus.

Recent videoconferences with scholars from the mainland and this one, as well as the conversations that took place, have not mentioned the terms "unification by force" or "anti-secession law," but rather the restoration of communication and dialogue.

Zhao Chunshan pointed out that the situation on the two sides of the Taiwan Strait is tense and dangerous, and that the mainland hopes to convey the intention to improve relations through the Nationalist Party.

Because there is no mutual trust between the two sides, the other side still wants to do a good job of helping the Taiwanese people, which means they do not want the two sides to damage their relationship.

According to Chao Chun-shan, Wang Huning personally gave instructions to Sun Tao to "resolve the demands of the farmers and fishermen in Taiwan", and if this could not be done comprehensively, it should be handled on a case-by-case basis.

The report did not mention whether the Nationalist Party had mentioned the issue of Chinese military aircraft and warships harassing Taiwan on a daily basis, or the issues of farmers and fishermen in Taiwan's rural and coastal areas, and whether Central News Agency reporters had asked about these issues.
French trade unions are organizing another large-scale demonstration against the government's pension reform plan.

On Saturday (February 11), French unions once again called for a nationwide mobilization against the government's pension reform plan, calling on citizens to take to the streets to voice their opposition.
This is the fourth day of the social movement against the government's pension reform plan.
How many people will respond to their call? This may affect the action plan of labor unions in the next step.

This is the fourth time in a month that the eight major French trade unions have jointly organized a nationwide mobilization, and it is the first time that the demonstration has been scheduled for Saturday.

Because for most French people Saturday is a day off, they do not need to choose between participating in a demonstration and going on strike, so the union associations hope that today's gatherings will attract more people to participate.

Today, transit unions, the subway and public rail companies did not call for a strike, and the subways should operate normally, and people can go to the rally site by car. In the areas where schools are starting winter vacation, people can travel normally.

The trade unions hope that more than one million people will attend the rally today, while the police expect a total of 600,000 to 800,000 people nationwide, and between 9,000 and 12,000 in the Paris region.

Since the start of the protests against the government's pension reform plan, polls have shown that most French people do not support delaying the mandatory retirement age from 62 to 64, but the number of people actually taking to the streets to participate in the demonstrations has been gradually decreasing.
The first strike and hunger strike protests on January 31st attracted 1.27 million to 2.5 million people across the country.
The protesters have shrunk to a national total of 7.7 million to 20 million people this week on Tuesday, February 7.
The pension reform proposal is currently being discussed in the French National Assembly.
In particular, the opposition parties, especially those led by the left-wing, have submitted numerous amendment proposals, which has slowed down the legislative process considerably.
The debate between the parties is becoming increasingly acrimonious.

A radical left-wing party, the French RESISTANCE party, recently posted a photo of a balloon with the image of the Minister of Labour on social media, which triggered the protests of the ruling party.
The Speaker of the National Assembly finally declared a ban on the parliamentarian for 15 days as punishment for his behavior.

Despite the fact that this reform plan has triggered the largest social upheaval in France in the past 20 years, the government has made only slight adjustments to the draft, but has not made any major concessions.

The trade unions are planning to stage another protest on Thursday, March 7, when the reform proposal is to be submitted to the Senate for discussion. They also plan to organize a demonstration on the day the proposal is discussed in the Senate.
China encourages raising the birth rate, with the goal of raising the quality of education through the promotion of donations of sperm to universities.

The Human Sperm Bank of Yunnan Province, China, released an advertisement on the 9th asking for donors with a college degree or enrolled students to donate sperm, offering a subsidy of up to RMB 4500 for successful donations of 8 to 12 times.

According to a report by Taiwanese media today, the message shot to the top of the Weibo trending list and prompted many provinces and cities, including Zhejiang, Shaanxi, Henan, Shandong, and Beijing, to follow suit.
According to the Liberty Times, China is encouraging university students to donate sperm.

According to the report, Yunnan Province Human Sperm Bank pointed out that sperm donors can receive a worth of 1,000 yuan in medical examinations, "particularly the examination of semen and chromosomes, which most people have never done, is very important in understanding their fertility status."
The candidates must meet the following criteria: be 165cm tall or taller, have a college degree or be a student, and have no color blindness, B hepatitis, or other genetic diseases.

According to the news report, the Shaanxi Provincial Human Sperm Bank has a poster with the slogan "Donate sperm for compensation, and it is an honor that is limitless," which calls on young people to respond to the sperm donation campaign and encourages netizens to share the related information, "so that the spirit of love can be transmitted."
The price in Shaanxi is higher than in Yunnan, and qualified donors can receive RMB 300 in cash per trip, and those who complete a certain number of donations can receive a RMB 5,000 subsidy.
Currently, the highest subsidy rate is 5150 yuan in Beijing.
The last chairman of the communist party of East Germany died today.
As a result, our party has lost an important leader.
On November 13, 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall was opened after 28 years of dividing East Berlin from Western powers, Modrow said he would help East Germany become a democratic country.
At the time, the Communist leaders were forced to step down because of the demands of protesters in various parts of East Germany who demanded democracy and freedom.
Gorbachev, who became leader of the Soviet Union after the fall of the Soviet Union, had demanded change in the Soviet-dominated Eastern Europe.
On 18 March 1990, Mdrola announced the first and only free elections in the GDR.
He no longer serves as prime minister as a result of the election results.
Although Mobutu underwent reforms, opponents accuse him of trying to delay the political changes and reunification that took place in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to reform rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Mdvro was found guilty of electoral fraud in the 1989 municipal elections, but did not serve time in prison.
There were claims that these charges were politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, MdR continued to serve in the German parliament, and from 1999 to 2004 he served as a Member of the European Parliament.
Mordor considers himself a reformer and hopes to change the Communist Party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters that he did not want East Germany to return, but he did acknowledge its achievements.
Mordor was born in 1928 in the then German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica, Poland), and received training as a mechanic.

He was a platoon leader in the youth fire brigade during World War II, and he became a member of the Nazi Volkssturm, a militia that recruited men aged 16 to 60 for the final war, when the conflict was nearing its end.
At the age of 17, Modrow was captured by the Soviet Red Army and taken to the Soviet Union, where he participated in anti-fascist courses and became a firm communist.
In 1949, the year that East Germany was founded, after returning home, he found a job as a machinist and continued his studies in social sciences and economics, earning a doctorate.
Krenz was a worker for the Free German Youth Movement, which almost all East German youth joined, and he rose to the head of the SED party in the DDR region between 1973 and 1989.
He also served in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany, holding the highest national office.
Iran commemorates the 40th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution, President Trump "idiot"

Iran held an official gathering to commemorate the 44th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution on Saturday, but anti-government hackers briefly interrupted President Ebrahim Raisi's television address.

President Ahmadinejad's television speech was interrupted for about a minute on the Internet, and a sign of the Iranian government's opponents, called "Edalat Ali(Ali Justice)", appeared on the screen.
There were also shouts of "Death to the Islamic Republic."
According to Reuters, Iran marked the anniversary of the revolution by hacking the state television station.

The Iranian government, led by the hardliner President Rouhani, is facing the biggest challenge from the young protesters who are demanding that they step down on the 44th anniversary of the Iranian Revolution, but Rouhani is still calling for the "deceived youth" to repent so that they can receive pardon from the Iranian Supreme Leader.
After 22-year-old Mahsa Amini died in the custody of the country's moral police in September, protests have continued nationwide in Iran.
Iran's security forces are carrying out the deadliest crackdown on protests since the Islamic Republic overthrew the 2,500-year-old monarchy in 1979.

As part of the amnesty for the anniversary of the revolution, the Iranian authorities released on Friday the hunger strikers who were detained for holding different views, Farhad Meisami and the Iran-French scholar Fereydoon Adelhagh.
Ayatollah Ali Khamenei issued an amnesty earlier today, which included some prisoners who were arrested during recent anti-government protests.
According to HRANA, as of Friday, 528 protesters have been killed, including 71 minors.
The report says that 70 government security personnel were killed.
According to reports, up to 19,763 protesters have been arrested.
Leaders in Iran and official media have been calling for a vote at the rally on Saturday to show support for the government and against the protests. This has been going on for several weeks now.
During the Iranian Revolution anniversary celebrations on Friday night, official media displayed fireworks as part of the government-sponsored festivities, and people chanted "Allahu Akbar!"
However, there were also many people shouting "Death to the Dictator!" at the rally.
On Saturday, the government television station aired footage from official gatherings across the country.

In Tehran, as part of the official celebrations, military equipment such as domestically produced anti-ballistic missiles, drones, anti-submarine cruisers, and other military equipment was on display.
The president's speech is often interrupted by the slogan "Death to America"—a slogan commonly heard at state rallies.

According to Reuters, Adelkhah, who has been in prison since 2019, is one of seven French nationals currently detained in Iran, which is one of the factors contributing to the deterioration of relations between Paris and Tehran in recent months.
She was sentenced to five years in prison for national security offenses in 2020.
Later, she was placed under house arrest, but in January she was sent back to prison.
Adelkhah denied the allegations.
A week before Messaoudi's release, supporters warned that he was in danger of dying of starvation due to his hunger strike.
He was arrested in 2018 for protesting the obligatory hijab.
The French Ministry of Foreign Affairs called for the restoration of Adelkhah's freedom of movement, including if she so wished, allowing her to return to France.
The balloon incident may have "woken up" America?
Strengthen restrictions on the export of technology to China
According to The Wall Street Journal, the United States is preparing to further tighten the export of technology to China following the balloon incident.

Current and former security officials have said that the balloon incident has highlighted the threat posed by China to national security, and that this will help to garner more political support for strengthening U.S. technology protection.
The United States claimed that the balloon carried antennas and sensors for intelligence gathering and communication.
According to Martijn Rasser, a former senior official at the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency and currently serving at the New American Security think tank in Washington, D.C.,
“This certainly provided fuel for the hardline view on China.”

White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said to reporters on Thursday that we will also consider taking more comprehensive actions to expose and counter China's more extensive surveillance activities, which pose a threat to our national security and that of our allies and partners.
" U.S. officials say they have reported the situation to governments in over 30 countries, and international coordination is critical to countering China's threats.

Emily Benso, a senior researcher at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, said in addition to the actions taken by the Biden administration, the newly established US-China Strategic Competition Special Committee of the United States House of Representatives may also put pressure on the United States to take more stringent measures to slow down China's development.
She said that Congress members will feel increasing pressure to take a more aggressive stance, and this may force the White House to adopt a more aggressive policy.
The Wall Street Journal reported that many advocates of stricter export controls were also pushing for the expansion of the scope of control, to include industries such as artificial intelligence.
The U.S. government is also in the process of implementing a foreign investment review plan to examine potential national security threats posed by investments in the United States from China.
Analysts say that the White House may face calls to expedite the implementation of the plan.
The "921 Earthquake" Relief and Recovery Programme

Search and rescue teams from dozens of countries have been working tirelessly in the rubble of thousands of buildings in Turkey and Syria since the earthquake hit, searching for survivors still trapped under the debris.
In the cold, they often urge silence, because they are desperate to hear any life from the crumbling concrete piles.
According to Reuters today, two women survived for several days in the rubble of the earthquake and were rescued.
However, the death toll from the earthquake has risen to 24,150.
Turkey's death toll is 20,665 people, and Syria's death toll is over 3,500 people.

The 7.8 magnitude earthquake that occurred on Monday continues to cause strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria, making it the seventh deadliest natural disaster of this century, surpassing the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan and coming close to the 31,000 deaths caused by the 2003 earthquake in neighboring Iran.
A similar magnitude 7.4 earthquake struck northwestern Turkey in 1999, killing more than 17,000 people.

The Turkish authorities stated on Saturday that the deadliest earthquake in the region in 20 years trapped two women for 122 hours, and rescue workers rescued the two women from the rubble of a collapsed building in Turkey.
A 55-year-old man, identified as Masallah Cicek, was rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, the largest city in southeastern Turkey.
In the cold conditions, rescuers often call for quiet, as they try to hear any signs of life from the crumbling concrete rubble.
In Samandag, Turkey, rescue workers crouched down on the rubble and whispered "Inshallah"—"God willing"—as they carefully reached into the rubble to rescue a 10-day-old baby.
He opened his eyes wide, and Yagiz Ulas, a baby, was wrapped in a blanket and taken to the field hospital.
Video footage shows that the rescue team also carried his mother away; she was dizzy and pale but conscious.
Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters that in the past 24 hours, 67 people were rescued from the rubble, and a total of 31,000 rescue personnel were mobilized in the affected areas.
He said that about 80,000 people are being treated in hospitals, and 1.05 million people have lost their homes due to the earthquake and are staying in temporary shelters.
As the cold winter weather makes it difficult for people to get food, there are increasingly criticisms of the reactions of the leaders of the two countries to the rescue efforts.
According to Syrian state media, President Bashar al-Assad and his wife Asma visited a hospital in Aleppo, which is said to be the first time he has visited the affected areas since the earthquake.
Earlier, the World Food Programme stated that due to the war situation, the stocks in the rebel-controlled northwestern part of Syria were on the verge of running out.
On Friday, Erdogan visited the Adiyaman province of Turkey, where he admitted that the government's response was not as fast as expected.
Opponents have seized on this issue to attack Erdogan, who is running for re-election on May 14th, but who may delay the vote due to the disaster.
Reuters reports that anger at the delay in providing assistance and starting rescue operations may affect the election.
Even before the earthquake, the vote was seen as the most serious challenge to Erdogan's rule in the past twenty years.
Erdogan called for unity and denounced what he called "negative politics for political gain."
The main opposition Republican People's Party (CHP) leader Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu criticized the government's response.
Critics say, "The earthquake is big, but the more serious problem is the lack of coordination, the lack of planning, and the incompetence."

VNA Hanoi - VNA correspondents reported that during the visit to Brunei Darussalam, on February 11, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife visited the University of Brunei Darussalam (UBD, commonly referred to as "Brunei University").
The University of Bandar Seri Begawan (UBD) officially established a partnership with Vietnam's FPT University in July 2013, with the main focus being on English language training.
In addition to English, French, German, Japanese, and Korean, Vietnamese is also taught at the university.
When visiting the University of Brunei Darussalam, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife interacted with students of the Vietnamese language class.

Phạm Minh Chính Prime Minister is happy that more and more foreigners are interested in learning Vietnamese, which in turn will contribute to promoting Vietnamese culture and customs in a positive way in the world.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh expressed the belief that the Vietnamese language teaching staff at the University of Vietnam would become stronger; and that the students in the Vietnamese class would become more interested in the Vietnamese language, and work hard to become fluent in it, and that they would become the ambassadors of the friendly relations between Vietnam and Vietnam.
Chinese: 範明政总理在这次机会中，还通过视频方式与在峴港市FPT-UBD全球中心学习英语的越南学生进行了交流，了解他们的特别是在疫情期间的学习情况。

Premier Pham Minh Chinh believes that the cooperation between FPT University in Vietnam and Brunei University is particularly symbolic, especially the FPT-UBD Global Center, in the educational cooperation between Vietnam and Brunei.

At the same time, I hope that the students of this center will make greater progress in their studies and make positive contributions to the development of the friendly and cooperative relations between Vietnam and Laos.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh highly praised the achievements of cooperation between Vietnam and Brunei in education, including the cooperation between FPT University and Brunei University, and the decision of Brunei University to include Vietnamese in its curriculum. He discussed these issues with the Minister of Education of Brunei and the leaders of Brunei University.

Phạm Minh Chính Prime Minister hopes that the University of Brunei Darussalam will continue to focus on ensuring the quality of Vietnamese language instruction and expand the size of the Vietnamese language class.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh also highly praised the positive effects of cooperation based on the memorandum of understanding on education cooperation signed in April 2014; he recommended that Vietnam and Brunei continue to provide more scholarships and effectively implement short-term exchange programs, such as the Global Discovery Programme and the Discovery Year.

Phạm Minh Chính, Prime Minister, highly praised the establishment of the university's first branch in Vietnam, as well as its increasingly significant role in the region and the world; and its further expansion of cooperation with Vietnamese higher education institutions.
To mark the occasion, Phạm Minh Chính and his wife planted a tree in the campus of Guangxi Normal University in Guilin city, Guangxi province, and wrote a message in the guestbook.

Phạm Minh Chính wishes that VGU will continue to develop and make greater contributions to Vietnam's education sector, especially in the process of sustainable development, and to cooperate with Vietnam's educational and training institutions on a deeper and broader basis.

Hoai Thanh/VNA - Hoai Thanh, VNA correspondent in Hanoi reports that the official visit to Singapore and Brunei by Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Binh Minh and his wife has been successfully completed, resulting in comprehensive, practical, and concrete results.
During the three days of the official visit to Singapore and Brunei, Pham Minh Chinh, the Prime Minister, participated in over 30 different activities.

The results achieved will contribute to the development of the comprehensive partnership between Vietnam and China and the strategic partnership between Vietnam and Morocco towards a more in-depth, broader, and effective direction.

Strengthening ties with Singapore and Brunei is a need for each country, aimed at improving the well-being of their respective peoples and at promoting peace, stability, and development in the region and the world.

During the meetings and talks, Pham Minh Chinh Prime Minister and the leaders of Singapore and Brunei agreed to strengthen the political trust between Vietnam and these countries through regular high-level delegation exchanges, effective implementation of various bilateral cooperation mechanisms, and the signing of important cooperation agreements.
Many cooperation documents were signed during this visit.

The memorandum of understanding signed with Singapore on the "Green and Digital Economy Partnership" and the action plan signed with Brunei for the period 2023-2027 to strengthen the comprehensive partnership between Vietnam and Brunei are two highlights.
Vietnam and Singapore signed the "Memorandum of Understanding on Green and Digital Economy Partnership."

At meetings with business leaders, panel discussions, or at economic forums, Pham Minh Chinh Prime Minister emphasized that Vietnam welcomes the expansion of investment in digital transformation, green energy, high-tech, and innovation and creativity in Singapore and Brunei.

This visit has not only helped to deepen the cooperation between Vietnam, Singapore and Brunei in traditional fields such as politics, diplomacy, economy, security, defense, education-training, oil and gas, tourism, and civilian exchanges, but has also created a framework for cooperation in new potential areas such as digital economy, green economy, energy transformation, innovation and creativity, smart cities, and sustainable development.

Both suggestions were approved by the leaders of the two countries.

In particular, Pham Minh Chinh, the Prime Minister, shared with the leaders of the two countries his desire for a unified, peaceful, stable, and prosperous ASEAN Community; and they agreed to strengthen cooperation and enhance the central role of ASEAN in the context of a complex and volatile international situation.

Thanks to the important achievements obtained, Pham Minh Chinh Prime Minister's official visit to Singapore and Brunei has contributed to effectively implementing the Vietnam Communist Party's Central Committee's resolution No. 12-KLW (Resolution No. 12-KLW) on the new situation, which is to prioritize strengthening relations with our neighboring countries in the East, as well as to contribute to the efforts to
What is the mysterious object that fell from the sky over Alaska?
On Friday afternoon (February 10), the United States military used the most advanced stealth fighter jet, the F-22, to shoot down an unknown object flying in the air over Alaska.
The location where the object was shot down is 10 miles from the Alaskan coast.
This is the second time in less than a week that the U.S. military has shot down an object in the air.
Last week, a Chinese spy balloon drifted for several days in U.S. airspace before being shot down over the coast of South Carolina.

The second object was first detected entering U.S. airspace on Wednesday evening, moving in the airspace over northeastern Alaska at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), roughly the size of a small car, smaller than the previous Chinese spy balloon that was shot down, according to the Pentagon.
The Pentagon also believes that there is no evidence that this object is controllable.

John Copple, the White House National Security Council strategic communications coordinator, said on Friday that although the specifics of the object flying in the air at high altitude are not yet known, it "constitutes a reasonable threat to civilian aircraft."
Kobby said that this object was different from the spy balloon that was found in the United States, as it did not have a "payload" suspended above it.
John Coby said, "We call it an 'object' because that's the best description we can make at the moment."
President Biden consulted with the Pentagon before ordering the strike on the object, and he made the decision "very carefully," Mr. Kobby added.

The official description of this object can be roughly summarized as follows: It is about the size of a small car, it has no steering wheel, no suspension, and a flying altitude of about one thousand meters.
However, these pieces of information do not answer basic questions, such as what the object is, which country it belongs to, and what its mission is.
Currently, there are many analyses and speculations online that suggest this could be another Chinese balloon.
It may have been sent to the Regent's Park Zoo from China, where it is part of a mission to spy on the US from the skies over Latin America.
There were also those who linked the "object" in Alaska to the "UFO" (UFO).

The report in the U.S. Newsweek magazine cited a tweet posted by former U.S. Congressman Peter Meijer on Friday saying, "I hope that this 'unidentified flying object' is not a spy balloon, but a legitimate UFO."
"The irony of joking about sending spacecraft and weather balloons to the same destination is surprising, but it doesn't justify a galactic conflict," Meijer said.
The News Journal says that doubts about the UFO story are not limited to Meijer.

Tennessee Republican Representative Tim Burchett criticized the government's cover-up of intelligence last month, calling on the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) to release a report on the "unidentified flying object."
Amazon's customer service left me doubting it was real.

This is the way Amazon typically handles this situation, he said.

When I read this book in high school, I was only looking for something to kill time with, and I didn't think I'd become addicted to it, since I didn't find the web novels of the starting point particularly attractive in the past.
Then... they fell into the pond.

According to this plot, the whole book is quite light-hearted and enjoyable, even during the first part when Ye Xiaocheng was still in the online game, even though the various guilds were competing against each other, it was still not too heavy-going because the usual content was filled with blood and gore from Ye Xiaocheng and the God of War.
As for the part of the competition, I felt a little bit of the pain of change and the alternation of old and new. (Maybe it's because I'm too sentimental.)
Reading the entire book took up a lot of my time in high school, but I just couldn't put it down.

The characters and the emotional lines are portrayed in a way that is extremely impressive. Some characters are only mentioned occasionally, but they still have a great impact on the readers, like the characters Yue Shao Tian, Huang Shao Tian, and Su Ming Tang, who have a large number of fans, despite not being the main characters. In a novel about esports, there is no character that is so detestable that you want to throw the book away

In terms of the romantic plot, there are no common flaws of the concubines and beauties in the traditional web novels in All-Pro's work. Everyone in the novel has a common thing in common: they all like Glory, the game, and they all want to win in a dignified way.
The conspiracies are small, but there aren't any big ones. Everyone looks so innocent and cute.
This may also be why there are no unpleasant characters in the book.
All of this is thanks to the IP.
Ignoring the phenomenon of web novels, All-Day is a good book in its own right.
In some ways, it really does give you a sense of excitement and emotion.
In April, all-pro is going to be anime-ized.

It is not recommended reading.
I read it not too long ago and reviewed it. Coincidentally, I saw a review of it written based on memory.
This book is not a short story collection, but rather a collection of fragments about love in everyday life.
The tone of this book is extremely plain, it is like plain water, the words and phrases are well composed and the plot is like the quiet streets of a summer afternoon, plain and quiet.
Each is a snapshot of a brief period of ordinary life, with no beginning and no end.
The final collection is titled "What We Talk About When We Talk About Love".

I think that this short story collection, and its title, are a form of performance art. The author is trying to express that love is not just a tragic-comedy of ups and downs, or a sea of stone and a desert of sand, but also that it is not just about the above or below, and that love is also a boring life of monotony, and a sense of helplessness and confusion about the future.
While reading this book, you may remember couples quarreling in front of you, friends with boring marriages, and unsatisfactory relationships.

This is the reason I do not recommend reading this book. From an aesthetic point of view, the writing and plot of this book are bland and boring, unless you are living in a fairy tale or in a world of sweetness, otherwise you will feel that the reading experience is boring and uninteresting.

From a philosophical perspective, the daily events do not provide any epiphanies or expand anyone's outlook or horizon (which is different from Marquez's "Love in the Time of Cholera"), and the brief scenes do not address any issues, such as what is the mistake that leads to the failure of love?
What are the reasons for the protagonist's marriage breakdown?
Therefore, I would not recommend you to read this book, whether you read it or not, it does not matter much.
The author's ideas are expressed more through techniques and genres than through plot, which is why the reading experience of this book is inferior.
The logic of the book is good, but the content is not enough.
It explains a lot about sales theory, why it works and how it works, but it's weak on how to do it, just pointing out the direction but not giving specifics.
Additionally, the book feels like it was pieced together.
There are both famous entrepreneurs and salespeople and also unknown people who are not in the limelight.
I don't know if these stories are meant to be examples or not. If some examples that the author experienced himself were added, they would be more convincing.
English: There is a lot of back and forth in the use of the word "customer" or "client."
In the title it's still the customer, but in the main text it's the customer.
There are also problems with misspellings, missing punctuation marks, and incorrect numbering in e-books.
In general, this book is a good choice for those who want to learn the theory of selling, but it is not suitable for people who have been working in sales and want to improve their sales performance.

This book is very basic and can be said to be a course for beginners. It can help everyone quickly understand the full picture of Internet finance, but to understand it in depth, you still need to do some research on your own.

However, it was written earlier, and the content related to the later Alipay and WeChat subsidy war to train user habits was not mentioned, so the current third-party payment share must be much smaller than the one mentioned in the book, right?
Nowadays, many people eat out with their phones, and merchants have abandoned UnionPay because of the high transaction volume.

However, I am still very grateful to the author for writing this introduction book, which shows that the author has at least several years of financial observation experience, and is very familiar with the development history of domestic and foreign finance. Therefore, the content is very easy to understand.
It is easy to write in a big way, but it is difficult to write in plain language.
I appreciate you, and I want you to know it!
The first factor in determining a person's level of job satisfaction is not the amount of salary, but whether or not they are given enough recognition and praise in their work.
According to Maslow's Hierarchy, after basic needs are met, the most urgent need is the need for psychological fulfillment - to be understood, recognized, and appreciated.

In fact, for most Chinese, the phrase "I love you but I can't say it out loud" is true. Even if they are filled with love, gratitude, and praise, they will keep it to themselves and not say it out loud.
The five languages of affirmation that the author describes in this book are: words of affirmation, quality time, acts of service, receiving gifts, and physical touch.

I think what is important is not that you know what the five languages of appreciation are, but that you can spontaneously and sincerely express these five languages of appreciation to the people around you, whether they are your family, friends, or colleagues.
The more intimate the relationship, the more we need to be thankful and show appreciation. This will make our lives more beautiful.
Learning to praise can also help companies retain talent to a certain extent and reduce the rate of resignations.
We would like to thank the translators for bringing us the exciting ideas and worlds from overseas.

Due to cultural differences between the East and West, and other reasons, there may be some differences in the languages, which is why I would recommend that you try to read the original version if you have the chance, as it would be enlightening.
Thank you to the authors and translators and editors for their hard work!

On the evening of September 23, my wife's phone was dropped, and I immediately ordered an 8p from Amazon Malaysia. There was a delivery delay because it wasn't an in-house store, but the price was unchanged (I was secretly happy about it), and the system showed that delivery would take at least until September 27.

My wife has been miserable without a phone for days, so she called me at 6:30 the next morning to ask me to think of a solution. Later, I found that 256 GB of storage was available on JD.com and could be delivered the same day, so I had to place another order right away.
I then immediately canceled Amazon's order.

Since the order was placed in the middle of the night, it is not possible to receive the package the next morning, and at 7:30, I called customer service to cancel the order. They responded that the order had already been canceled, and I should wait for a notification by text message.

Well, I'll just wait patiently, and when I checked my phone in the afternoon, I found that the order was still in the status of "not shipped," so I immediately contacted customer service to request that they cancel the order. The customer service representative replied that they had already processed it.

When I checked my order at 3 p.m., it was still pending, so I had to call customer service again to inform them that I had called for the third time and to ask them to cancel the order and inform the seller not to ship the goods!

The customer service representative called the seller on my request, and informed me that the seller was not familiar with the system and that I would have to wait until the seller was familiar with the system before they could cancel the order.
However, make sure to tell me that the seller knows about this and will definitely not send the item.
By Monday, I looked at the order again and it showed that it had been shipped. I was speechless.
Since I could not directly contact the seller, I had to call the customer service department again.
The follow-up processing was practically incomprehensible. It was mostly me saying something, and then the customer service would proceed with it.
So far, the order is still in the state of rejecting delivery. We are preparing to send it again!
Is Amazon not going to follow up on this?
The seller company has already received the money, so they don't care either.
In conclusion, we will definitely not be pre-paying for large items in the future. This is too troublesome.
